com.cyc.session

Class CycServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.session.internal.GenericServerAddress
      • com.cyc.session.CycServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<GenericServerAddress>

    public class CycServer
extends GenericServerAddress
implements Serializable
    Describes the address of a Cyc server. This class encapsulates a Cyc server's host name, base port, and offset ports. It is easily serializable, and contains methods for being instantiated from a string.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        @Deprecated
public static final CycServer DEFAULT
        Deprecated. May be removed in 1.0.0-rc2.
        This is the default location of a Cyc server, but you should be very wary of assuming it.

      • guessBasePortFromOffsetPort

        public static Integer guessBasePortFromOffsetPort(int port)
        Attempts to guess the base port of a CycServer from an offset port. For example, given a port of 3654, we can somewhat safely guess that the base port would be 3640.

        Be very careful with this method. It is only a guess, and this method can (and has!) been wrong before. There's no guarantee that a Cyc server will be running in the 3600 block; if a Cyc server is running at, e.g., 3780 (which is rare, but entirely possible), and this method is given '80', it will incorrectly guess that the base port is 3680. In short, any time you use this method, make sure that any potential errors are visible to users, and can reasonably be corrected by them.

        Parameters:
        port -
        Returns:
        the base port number
